subject: Olympic Games (2016)
Golf
Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: A total of 120 golfers would compete in four-round stroke-play competitions under a proposal to add golf to the 2016 Olympics. The International Golf Federation submitted its plan to the International Olympic Committee on Feb. 15. Under the plan, the top 60 men’s and women’s golfers, based on the official world rankings, would participate. The top 15 players would automatically be eligible. A maximum of two players from each country that did not already have two or more among the top 15 would also be eligible. (The United States has five men’s players ranked in the top 15, including No. 1 Tiger Woods and No. 5 Phil Mickelson.) A three-hole playoff would break any ties for the gold, silver and bronze medals. As part of its bid, the golf federation said the sport’s leading organizations would adjust their schedules to avoid conflicts during the Games.
